p: Considering that increasing temperature along with climate change is the main exposure climatic variable, the RS results suggested that six infectious diseases were affected by temperature change in more than 50% of the effective counties and cities in Anhui Province from 2004 to 2010; they are: HFM, malaria, influenza, typhoid fever, meningitis, and schistosomiasis. In contrast, dysentery, hepatitis A and hemorrhagic fever were affected in less than 50% of the effective counties and cities. Special hemorrhagic fever was affected in only 10% of the effective counties.
